history.content: If you just want to limit yourself to frontend stuff you should save yourself hundreds of thousands of dollars and enroll in a yourself in a bootcamp. It honestly isn't a very involved job and definitely does not require a degree in computer science. Neither of those two classes are relevant for front end web development, but they will look better for applying to internships than 188. If you are aiming for a career or internship in making CRUD apps, I suggest you drop 188 and take both 161 and 186. All 3 CS classes are pretty light in terms of workload. I do not have any experience with EE16B, but if it is around the same workload as a medium workload upper division like 170, taking all 4 wouldn't be much of a problem anyway.

This is how my schedule looks like right now. I am still deciding whether I should drop either 186 or 161. However, 161 took me an effort to get in though. I have consulted multiple people and they said that CS 186 doesn't really help you excel during internships (assuming you are not doing backend stuff) and I might as well substitute 186 with one of those CS198's. Ruby on Rails might be a good choice. 

Looking for some comments. Thanks in advance.
history.subject: CS 186, CS161, CS188 and EE16B
